Detailed Description

Author:
Jaakko Luttinen Player is a class for a player in the game. Player has name, color, points, ranking, money, integrity and a cannon.

void Player::doDamage (  Player *  shooter,
float  damage
) 
 

Player takes the given damage. Damage may have a player as a source. Calculates damage points as well.

Game engine will call this to notify the player that the simulation has ended. Not for others!

bool Player::isDead (   ) 
 

Tells whether the player is dead. Player is dead if at least one of the following conditions is met: 1) player has no cannon; 2) player's cannon is ruined; 3) player's integrity is zero; 4) player has no ammunition left.

void Player::quit (   ) 
 

Raises a flag to tell that the player wants to quit the game.

void Player::removeAI (   ) 
 

Removes the AI from player.

void Player::removeCannon (   ) 
 

Removes the cannon from player.

Selects a weapon.

Parameters:
change How many steps to take in weapon selection.
Returns:
Returns the selected weapon, or NULL.

void Player::setActive (  bool  active  ) 
 

Sets the player active or passive. That is, the cannon will be shown differently when the player has turn.

Parameters:
active Active=true, passive=false.

void Player::setAI (  Ai &  newAI  ) 
 

Sets the AI for the player. Player will free the memory allocation.

Parameters:
newAI AI for the player.

int Player::setLocation (  float  x,
float  y
) 
 

Tries to set the location for the player's cannon. Selects the nearest planet and its nearest point on its surface.

Parameters:
x X-coordinate.
y Y-coordinate.
Returns:
Return values are following: 0: success. -1: world does not exist. -2: didn't find a planet. -3: too close to other player, please try again.

void Player::setMoney (  int  money  )  [inline]
 

Sets player's money.

money The money for the player.

Returns:
The selected weapon, or NULL.

void Player::shoot (   ) 
 

Shoots with selected weapon.

void Player::shootSimulation (   ) 
 

Simulates a shot. Does not do any permanent changes.

void Player::startSimulation (   ) 
 

Game engine will call this to notify the player of a starting simulation. Not for others!

const int Player::minimumDistance = 40 [static]
 

Minimum distance between two alive cannons on same planet.
